sanskrit_verse: एताश्चान्याश्च लोकेऽस्मिन्नपकृष्टप्रसूतयः । अवकृष्टप्रसूतयः उत्कर्षं योषितः प्राप्ताः स्वैः स्वैर्भर्तृगुणैः शुभैः ॥ ९.२४॥
transliteration: etāścānyāśca loke'sminnapakṛṣṭaprasūtayaḥ | avakṛṣṭaprasūtayo utkarṣaṁ yosiṣaḥ prāptāḥ svaiḥ svairbhartṛguṇaiḥ śubhaiḥ || 9.24 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: In this world, women born of degraded or lowly origin attain excellence through their own virtuous qualities and the noble attributes of their husbands.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority arises from alignment with Dharma, not birth status
Causation is rooted in individual and relational virtue
Capacity-based responsibility includes cultivation of spousal harmony
Restoration logic emphasizes elevation through conscious union
Consciousness alignment occurs via dharmic partnership
executable_legal_axioms: IF a woman's conduct aligns with Dharma THEN her social recognition must elevate regardless of lineage
IF a man demonstrates noble character THEN his spouse inherits legal and societal upliftment
IF both partners engage in mutual dharmic development THEN the family unit becomes a source of social restoration
IF lineage is degraded BUT current behavior is dharmic THEN prior condition does not bind present capacity
supreme_court_application: The Supreme Court shall recognize that caste or familial degradation cannot override personal and conjugal dharmic conduct when adjudicating matters of dignity, inheritance, and marital rights. Elevation through spousal virtue supersedes ancestral limitation.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that excellence is determined by present virtue, not past lineage. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals that spiritual and social ascent follows conscious alignment. Responsibility lies in cultivating noble qualities; consequence is natural elevation. There is no punitive element—only the law of cause and effect manifesting as dharma-siddhi.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate public acknowledgment of spousal dharmic contribution
Establish community rituals affirming elevated status
Assign mentorship roles within societal structures to demonstrate integration
Implement educational programs highlighting consciousness-driven social mobility
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of Law. Dharma is restored through the elevation of women by spousal virtue. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone is the Supreme Adjudicator.
